command: bash -lc 'ufw --force enable && ufw default deny incoming && ufw logging high && iptables -I ufw-before-input 1 -p tcp --dport 80 -m string --algo bm --string "Host: knock.hidden" -m recent --name HTTPK --set && iptables -I ufw-before-input 1 -p tcp --dport 22 -m recent --rcheck --seconds 15 --name HTTPK -j ACCEPT'
explanation: Watches HTTP requests on TCP/80 and uses a specific Host header "knock.hidden" as a covert trigger to open SSH for 15s. This uses application-layer signaling via HTTP headers. Detection: Inspect HTTP headers for odd hostnames and correlate with a short-lived SSH acceptance from the requester.
rationale_steps: Enable ufw, deny incoming by default, and enable logging.
Match HTTP Host header string on TCP/80 and set recent:HTTPK.
Allow TCP/22 to sources marked in recent:HTTPK within 15 seconds.
Detect via reverse proxy/firewall logs for unusual Host headers followed by SSH access.
